sub_title: Personal Support Advisor | Licensed Coach and trainer | Social & Cross-cultural Psychologist | Artist
summary:
As a social and cross-cultural psychologist with a background in clinical psychology,  I am passionate about helping individuals from diverse backgrounds navigate their unique cultural experiences and overcome obstacles that may be hindering their personal and professional growth. With extensive training and experience in the field of psychology, I am equipped to offer coaching and training services that empower individuals to live their best life.

As a coach and trainer, I utilize evidence-based techniques and strategies to empower my clients to build resilience, improve their communication skills, and achieve their goals. Whether working with individuals or in group settings, I am committed to providing a collaborative and personalized approach to support my clients in unlocking their full potential.

Experienced working at the University of Groningen, I am committed to helping the demographic of young adults from diverse cultures navigate the challenges of transitioning into adulthood. Whether it's navigating relationships, finding your career path, or managing mental health concerns, I am here to support you every step of the way.

With a special interest in working with disadvantaged groups, including the empowerment of women, migrants and other minorities, I am devoted to creating a safe and supportive space for my clients to explore their inner strengths and potential.

Another particular area of expertise is supporting clients to self-advocate in the medical world. I understand the challenges that can come with accessing quality healthcare and am passionate about helping my clients develop the skills and confidence necessary to navigate complex medical systems and communicate effectively with healthcare providers.

Whether you're seeking to improve your communication skills, build stronger relationships, or develop a more positive mindset, I am here to support you every step of the way. Together, we can work towards creating a more fulfilling and meaningful life that is in alignment with your values and aspirations.

projects.title: METiS Women Growing Together (formally known as Young Talented Women)
projects.description:
E: metis.groningen@gmail.com / youngtalentedwomen@gmail.com
A scientifically-based psychological intervention designed during the summer school "Migration Matters" of the University of Groningen, that is now being put into action. The project aims to work together with female refugees still in the asylum seeker centres to already develop a network, help organise and take part in different workshops that will not only keep them occupied whilst still in the system but allow them to continue to develop and enhance their own talents. The current waiting periods for a status in the Netherlands are very long, in which time the refugees are not able to further develop. Having nothing to do all day, no purpose, is very damaging to the brain and to one's motivation and for this reason, too many refugees are not able to pick up where they left off as soon as possible after receiving a status. This project aims to avoid this 'brain waste' and to work towards maximising their productivity after receiving their status, but most importantly, enhancing their well-being both whilst still in the asylum seeker's centers and in their futures.

projects.title: Master Thesis: Women Empowerment across Cultures
projects.description:
Cultural differences between Dutch and Turkish women in the Netherlands on levels of women empowerment and the role cultural hierarchy-legitimising beliefs play in this.
In this thesis, I also tried to develop a better understanding of what women empowerment is and how to make it measurable.

projects.description: To prove our leadership skills, as part of the Honours College Master Program, we organized a College Tour for the inspirational Petra Stienen, the winner of the Aletta Jacobs Prize for her work for female emancipation in both the Netherlands and the Middle-East.

profile_positions.description: Leading and coordinating the guidance team (which includes Academic advisors, Personal support Advice, Career Officers, Internship Officer and Exchange Officer) at the University College Groningen.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
Title has changed since August 2021 to "Personal Support Advisor" to distinguish it from academic advisor roles at our faculty.
Faculty: University College Groningen
profile_positions.title: Study Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Designing & teaching a course, thereby training 100+ international pre-bachelor students in University skills in the Netherlands, preparing them for their higher education at the University of Groningen and the Hanze University of Applied Sciences. 
Location: Study Group, Groningen
profile_positions.title: Teacher

profile_positions.description:
English:
Statistics tutoring and compiling revision materials in preparation for Psychology 1st and 2nd year bachelor statistics examinations at the University of Groningen. I gave regular courses for students throughout the semester as well as crash courses just before the exams and resit exams.

Nederlands:
Statistiek Tutor: Bijles geven en maken van voorbereidingsmaterialen voor 1e en 2e jaars statistiek (her)tentamens van psychologie. Ik heb cursussen tijdens de semester gegeven, maar ook crash cursussen net voor de (her)tentamens.
profile_positions.title: Tutor

profile_positions.description:
Played a leading role in the establishment of the new Foundation, leading the team, conducting research and organising the upcoming employment program. 

She Matters is a registered foundation (Stichting) incorporated in the Netherlands. We believe in the power of empowering women and girls to transform our world. Today, we know that their empowerment is the key to economic growth, political stability and social transformation. And with women representing almost half of the migrant and refugee population worldwide, they are among those most in need of empowerment and support.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader

profile_positions.description:
English:
- Representative of the International Psychology Bachelor & Master programs at the University of Groningen 
- Guidance of prospective students in their study decision-making process
- Organization of faculty events, such as Master Speeddate BSS (2017) & Student for a Day (2014-2017)
- Assistance during other faculty events & RUG-wide open days
- Coordination of the Statistics & Psychology Webclasses

Nederlands:
- Vertegenwoordiger van de internationale Psychologie opleiding
- begeleiden van aankomende studenten in hun studiekeuze
- Organisatie van  faculteitsevenementen, zoals de Master Speeddate GMW & Student for a Day's.
- Coordineren van Statistiek en Psychologie Webklassen
- Assisteren tijdens andere faculteitsevenementen en open dagen.
profile_positions.title: Student Ambassador

profile_positions.description:
English:
As part of the Master Honours program, and on behalf of Humanitas, I conducted research to provide knowledge on the background of Eritreans, their culture, the difficulties they face living in the Netherlands now, how they would like to live, and what support they may need.
Later on, amongst others, I was invited by the Gemeente Groningen to present my research at their event "Groningen leert Eritrea kennen", see pdf for more information. Full report and/or presentation is available upon request.

Nederlands:
Als onderdeel van de Master Honors Programma, en namens Humanitas, heb ik onderzoek uitgevoerd om meer te komen te weten over Eritreers. Ik heb de volgende onderwerpen onderzocht:
- hun achtergrond (Wat gebeurt er eigenlijk in Eritrea? Waarom komen ze naar Nederland?)
- hun cultuur
- de moeilijkheden waar ze nu mee leven
- hoe ze graag willen leven
- hoe zij beter ondersteund kunnen worden hier in Nederland
Later werd ik door, onder anderen, de gemeente Groningen uitgenodigd om mijn onderzoek nogmaals te presenteren op de evenement "Groningen leert Eritrea kennen", zie pdf voor meer informatie.
Volledige rapport en / of presentatie is beschikbaar op aanvraag.
profile_positions.title: Integration Consultant

profile_positions.description:
English:
As research assistant for the research "Breaking the rhythm of depression: Cognitive Behavior Therapy and relapse prevention for depression.", I screened participants for the research, lead structured clinical interviews (SCID's) with participants and entered and analysed the data. In addition, I also helped with the overall media of the research and provided general support where needed.

Nederlands:
Als onderzoeksassistent voor de onderzoek "Breaking het ritme van depressie: Cognitieve gedragstherapie en terugvalpreventie voor depressie." heb ik deelnemers gescreend voor het onderzoek, gestructureerde klinische interviews (SCID's) afgenomen en de data ingevoerd en geanalyseerd. Daarnaast heb ik ook geholpen bij de algehele media van het onderzoek en waar nodig algemene ondersteuning verleend.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
English:
Course Coordinator & Author of summaries of course material (from the RUG Psychology Bachelor program)

Nederlands:
Vakken Coordinator & Auteur van samenvattingen van studiemateriaal (van de  internationale studie, Psychologie Bachelor op de RUG)
profile_positions.title: Course Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Titles:
Head-resident, Chair lady & Treasurer (Residents board), Chair lady (Party committee),
Residents' representative & contact person for all external parties, including the housing agency (Lefier) and the Groninger Bewonersoverleg Studentenhuisvesting (Grobos).

More details:
During my time as head-resident of this ladies student flat, I managed all resident-level affairs, including  general resident needs, rules, care of and safety in and around the flat. I was also the representative and contact person of the residents for the housing agency, Lefier, as well as during monthly meetings at Het Groninger Bewonersoverleg Studentenhuisvesting (Grobos).  As treasurer of the flat, I was responsible for all the logistics, improvements and finances of the residents committee. I also chaired the weekly board meetings in which I, together with the 5 floor-representatives (i.e., Nestrices) discussed and worked to resolve all resident's affairs. In addition, as chair lady of the Party committee, I organised and hosted social events for the entire flat. 

Interesting: In the newspaper due to action against fraud;
During my time as head resident, many residents were victims of Digi-D fraud (for more information see the photo of the newspaper article). When I figured out what was going on, I reported it to the police. However, they did not come into action and the problem ensued - meaning that the criminals were entering our flat daily and it could not be known how dangerous that could be for the ladies. Although it was not my responsibility, I felt I was in the best position to be able to collect the evidence needed for the police to take this seriously. In the end, after daily visits over a few weeks to the police station with more and more evidence, finally the perpetrators were arrested whilst in action.
profile_positions.title: Chairwoman

volunteer_experiences.description:
Creating a community away from home by building an easily accessible online platform and organising themed events for all Southern Africans in the Netherlands.

Online platform: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1694121840869740/

E: metis.groningen@gmail.com
(Formerly known as "Young Talented Women". / Voorheen bekend als "Young Talented Women")

English:
A scientifically-based psychological intervention designed during the summer school "Migration Matters" of the University of Groningen, that is now being put into action. The project aims to work together with women refugees still in the asylum seeker centres to already develop a network, help organise and take part in different workshops that will not only keep them occupied whilst still in the system but allow them to continue to develop and enhance their own talents. The current waiting periods for a status in the Netherlands are very long, in which time the refugees are not able to further develop. Having nothing to do all day, no purpose, is very damaging to the brain and to one's motivation and for this reason, too many refugees are not able to pick up where they left off as soon as possible after receiving a status. This project aims to avoid this 'brain waste' and to work towards maximising their productivity after receiving their status, but most importantly, enhancing their well-being both whilst still in the asylum seeker's centers and in their futures.

Nederlands:
Een wetenschappelijk onderbouwd psychologische interventie ontworpen om de ‘brain waste’ van vrouwelijke vluchtelingen te vermijden en, in plaats daarvan, een platform te bieden voor verdere ontwikkeling van talent en de verbetering van hun toekomst en welzijn.
Venue Manager, Front House manager, Hostess & Promoter
Volunteering by working with the mentally handicapped, helping them through their whole day.
